title: South Africa's Pick n Pay posts 9.5% rise in first-half earnings
text:
South Africa's Pick n Pay posts 9.5% rise in first-half earnings

Stock Markets 8 hours ago (Oct 22, 2019 07:36)

© Reuters. South Africa's Pick n Pay posts 9.5% rise in first-half earnings JOHANNESBURG, Oct 22 (Reuters) - South African supermarket retailer Pick n Pay Stores Ltd posted a 9.5% rise in first-half earnings on Tuesday, boosted by its core local operations despite challenges in Zambia and Zimbabwe. Pick n Pay, which also sells clothes, said comparable headline earnings per share (HEPS) for the 26 weeks ended Sept.1 rose to 85.03 cents from a restated 77.67 cents a year earlier. Reported HEPS, which includes the impact of hyperinflation accounting in Zimbabwe, rose 17.5%.

South Africa's Pick n Pay posts 9.5% rise in first-half earnings
